intro: Tarenna guelcheriana var. angustata, commonly known as narrow-leaf tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. This species is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
